website_summaries.verdict: This case makes packing easy for the on-the-go businessperson, and it fits under airline seats and in overhead compartments.
pros: laptop inside 3 large, durable, padded compartments and includes a plethora of pockets for mobile devices, business cards, and other tools
cons: 2 rubber wheels could make it hard to maneuver in tight spaces
Some reports of flat spots forming on wheels over time

customer_reviews.title: Handles are a weak link
customer_reviews.text: Less than one year and the leather on the handles already cracked and separated. To me, that's ridiculously fast to wear out. Really ruins the piece. If it weren't for that, it would be excellent--good use of space, thoughtful design, spacious.
customer_reviews.author: SBKnowlton

customer_reviews.title: Poor durability!
customer_reviews.text: This bag has potential, as long as you carry it everywhere and don't roll it anywhere. I got it to transport my 17" laptop and it houses it well with lots of pockets for other stuff. Excellent. Not so fast. See, I made the mistake of rolling it on the wheels through the smooth airport floors 3 times. 3 times. Now? Klak klak klak... A wheel is flat spotted. Unacceptable for such a new and lightly used bag. The wheels are as delicate as a snowflake that found out they're not special. Stay away from this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: My wife LOVES IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my wife who is a realtor. It for all off her paperwork and files. The case takes stress off her from having to carry multiple bags and briefcases. The wheels work perfectly. She LOVES IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Reggie Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Was great but didn't last
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: It's August and the bag has a hole in it. Just to reiterate I won't buy another and would not recommend this. Thought this was a great gift for my friend who carries way too many work docs in his bag causing shoulder pain. Anyway he really likes all the compartments and room until today. I purchased the bag in February and now in June it's falling apart which is unacceptable and embarrassing to me as the gift giver. Won't buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Smith

customer_reviews.title: do not waste your time and money on this one
customer_reviews.text: This product is falsely labled big time!!. I was so excied to find a rolling case that said it was for computers up to 17.3. But nooooooo, this one only measures 15" on the slot that says it is fully padded (HAHA) . do not waste your time and money on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointing in this item not fitting like it says in the description
customer_reviews.text: This Item will NOT FIT a Acer Predator 17.3" laptop as described. I am very disappointing in this item not fitting like it says in the description. I would like too see anyone who has gotten a Acer predator 17.3" laptop in this case without modifying it first.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handle will not release after 2 trips not good
customer_reviews.text: the handle will not release after taking it on the road 2 times I liked the size and was hopeful for a good product but it isn't I would like to send this back to someone or have them send me something else
customer_reviews.author: Ken Crawford

customer_reviews.title: The Zippers Stick
customer_reviews.text: This model was able to hold my 17.3 inch laptop, but it had no room to spare, so perhaps not all 17.3 laptops would fit. My problem is that the zippers get caught on the material that fans out when you open or close the bag. This design flaw is highly annoying when you try to open or close the bag, and a very good reason not to buy this laptop bag
customer_reviews.author: CHL

customer_reviews.title: Overrated and Poorly Made
customer_reviews.text: The handle was a wobbly mess and the interior lining was pretty flimsy as well. Of course I didn’t expect grade A craftsmanship, but a nice sturdy handle isn’t too much to ask. At this level, you are better off going th Amazon Basics route and saving some $$$$
customer_reviews.author: Flamo

customer_reviews.title: Good bag at a decent price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this nearly a year ago and it's still going strong. It's got plenty of pockets and places to put things. I carry TWO (2) laptops and supporting equipment (cables, mice, etc.) and supplies to and from work every day which includes a car, a bus, a train and a shuttle bus each way. My only complaints are these: The wheels are rather loud and 2/3 of the pockets don't go all the way to the bottom creating one big pocket with dividers. These are minor complaints though. It's durable and there's no tearing at all and I'm not particularly gentle with it.,
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Estep

customer_reviews.title: Was what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: So far it has worked great. I needed it for my laptop, projector, cords, surge protector. Jabra, then files and stapler fit no problem! I have to park a few blocks from my office and only used a handful of times before Covid shut us down, but so far it is great and keeps everything together for me. It did not smell good initially inside, just tear up a dryer sheet and put a piece in each compartment. Then leave it open when not using and it will be gone in a couple of days!
customer_reviews.author: Prime Addicted Mom

customer_reviews.title: Just ok....if you don't expect much
customer_reviews.text: would be better if it had more organizational pockets instead on one cavernous space.....and a laptop slot. Not impressed. The telescoping handle is flimsy too and one wrong move could rip the wheels off this thing. I would NEVER attempt to actually travel with this carrier/ bag. It is not sturdy enough for that. Good for leaving in the car so your stuff doesn't go flying around everywhere. Another waste of money!! No...I didn't save the shipping box it came in. I wasn't expecting to want to return it. Save your money. Go for quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ursula E

customer_reviews.title: A back saver
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this laptop bag for a month now but can already see an improvement in my back. I had a backpack to carry my laptop to and from the office but starting having issues with my left shoulder and back. Since getting the rolling bag my back is almost back to normal. My laptop fits very well and room from my wireless mouse and wires. I work from home as well as in office so commuting back and forth can be troublesome when having to carry project folders, portfolios and note books from meetings but with this bag has plenty of room. Very satisfied with this project.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, seems durable and is a high quality luggage grade bag
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought this for my birthday since I am a musician and needed something to tote my tablet, books and sheet music to gigs. I used to carry around a bag with a shoulder strap but it wore out and looked really unsightly on gigs. This bag looks great, seems durable and is a high quality luggage grade bag with lots of room and little pockets inside for things like pens, etc. What is really nice is that when it gets heavy, I can just roll it around.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & large capacity
customer_reviews.text: I am a teacher & I can fit all my work needs in this bag. Back: 2 laptops (15" & 13"), power cord in pockets, power strip, & headphones Middle: combinations of 2-4 notebooks, 3-6 files, &/or 1" binders Front: pens/pencils, tablet & charging cable, cell phone, small notebooks, post-it note pads I've walked in the rain and my things stay dry inside. It is easy to switch from rolling to carrying. Fits perfectly in the foot-well behind the drivers seat, so it will definitely fit airplane requirements if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Katana

customer_reviews.title: one of the wheels broke after 8 months of relatively light use
customer_reviews.text: This case has plenty of storage spare and sufficient individual slots that items can be categorized; an outstanding feature. However, in my opinion the wheels will not hold up for a regular traveller. one of the wheels broke on me after roughly 8 months of back and forth to work travel. not recommended. spend more money and get something more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher R. Schene

customer_reviews.title: Jim tough bag!
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine feb 2017. Pretty much toast now. I ripped the handle off though may have to do with the fact that I am kinda strong, and the bag got caught. I pulled and ripped the handle odd. I am extremely rough on things and frankly this has lasted thru abuse daily, routinely overloaded and generally mistreated. That said it lasted until about sept this year and the zippers started going, the seams came loose in the front, and I rippled the telescoping handle off. I gorilla taped it back on and the bag still works. I am buying another one soon.
customer_reviews.author: Professor JWN

customer_reviews.title: I really like this bag
customer_reviews.text: I get assigned to different offices and get tired of setting up all my things only to have to remove them to go to the next office. This bag saves my having to look for a box when it's time to transfer offices again. It has lots of storage compartments and it looks professional. The only thing that irritates me is the handle; it's not always easy to retract or extend. I sometimes have to struggle with it. Other than that I love this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Urekasgold

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and takes a beating!
customer_reviews.text: I teach high school, this thing is packed full, and roughly treated, so far almost done with the first semester and it doesn’t look any different. Don’t know what topping over ppl refer to, mine stands straight even packed to the gills. I like that the laptop sleeve is actually towards to middle of the bag, helps even the weight distribution. ONLY complaint is a lack of shoulder strap, I’d like the option, ya know, for stairs. Great daily briefcase bag.
customer_reviews.author: larissa maranell

customer_reviews.title: First Impressions.
customer_reviews.text: First day. Switched from my old, heavy, leather rolley bag. First impressions: This bag is so much lighter than my old bag. The wheels are quiet. The handle is nice and steady. The zipper compartments are good sized, with nice size pockets. Sure wish there were zipper compartments inside the larger zipper sections, so things would stay in place. Not five stars because there is no laptop sleeve for protection against jarring bumps or drops. I'm very surprised there isn't more padding for laptop protection.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Did not work well for me
customer_reviews.text: It is cheaply made and I had trouble getting it to zip. I would have overlooked that and kept it for such a cheap price but when I extended the handle it was so short I had to bend over to hold on to it. This was the tipping point. No one wants to bend over to hold on to the handle to pull it. I returned it and ordered one that was much more expensive but has arrived and it so much better in quality and handle is long. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha  Blum

customer_reviews.title: High use and the perfect bag
customer_reviews.text: Great bag!!!! I use it everyday and going back and forth. I work remote some days and go to the office on the other days, so I needed reliable me bag. I am a project manager so I have lots of documents to carry and need lots of stargaze space. This bag is perfect! It’s sturdy, great quality and I have not had any issues. I carry a laptop in it, filing folders, stable, pens, charging cord, notebooks. It is perfect!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Em Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Despite the title of this product, it does not fit a 17" laptop.
customer_reviews.text: As someone else said in their review, this case does not fit a 17" laptop. It will fit in the non-padded area, however, you can feel the hard handle behind the laptop. This does not seem like a safe or secure way to transport a 3k dollar laptop. For reference, I have a Dell Precision 7720.
customer_reviews.author: Mike G

customer_reviews.title: LIGHTWEIGHT and STREAMLINED
customer_reviews.text: This computer bag has it all, and at a very reasonable price. My laptop fits perfectly. Have a sleeve for the power cord and mouse, and there is plenty of room for this. The side compartments a are perfect for file folders, notebooks, any extra paperwork that needs to accompany you on vacation, business trip, etc. The pull handle makes transport easy with very smooth rollers. I had a much bigger case for my computer, but was very heavy and bulky. This one is lightweight and streamline. Have not tried in overhead compartment on a plane yet, but suspect will be a breeze. A definite 5 Star rating. You will not go wrong in giving this one a look.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Fits 17.3 inch laptop? No, not so much.
customer_reviews.text: I was glad I finally found a roller the specifically said it would fit a 17.3" laptop. It does not. I have a Helios Predator 17.3" that did not quite fit in my current Swiss Gear Granada, so I needed to move up. When I received the Bryant Solo, I found that it is no bigger than a standard Swiss Gear roller. The pictures tell the story. The construction was okay. It seemed sturdy, although umit as robust as the Swiss Gear. Wish it was a big as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Tinney

customer_reviews.title: Decent bag
customer_reviews.text: I have a large laptop, server quality. The laptop pocket fits my pc, with a bit of wiggle room depth wise. I am at the limit on width. A slim notebook would fit with a protective sleeve case and then some. One of the wheels came warped, so it makes some noise rolling. I'm usually outside walking between buildings on a large industrial campus. Holds up well on asphalt. Airplane travel: too large to qualify as personal item, does not fit under seat, too small for me to use as a carryon without checking a bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Helms-Wright

customer_reviews.title: Durable AF!
customer_reviews.text: I heard a few things about it durability but I have no problems with it. It's a tinsey bit on the small side but it fits everything I need it for. The laptop slot barely fits my huge laptop but it does. The wheels and handle are amazingly durable. I run it over rocks ever morning at work, up and down stairs and even carry it short distances by the handle when it's extended. I don't use the grab handles that much so that might be why there's no wear and tear but it's lasted a year and has no signs of giving up on me! Love it
customer_reviews.author: LOLaurie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I really love it I use it everyday I love you hat it has wheels 😄
customer_reviews.author: Araceli Gomez

customer_reviews.title: A LIFESAVER, SERIOUSLY!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a real lifesaver for me. When commuting to work I have a HUGE 17.3 inch laptop AND another 15inch laptop. You could imagine how much weight that was on my back before purchasing this bag. Everything fits perfectly in the bag and I still have space to fit more items in it! I no longer feel any back or leg pain after my commute! This was a GREAT purchase and I'd Recommend to everyone if you are debating on this bag to purchase it!
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa White

customer_reviews.title: Much more room than it appears ....
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a good looking, nicely sized rolling laptop bag for a couple of years. I finally purchased this bag and I have to say I am totally impressed. It does not appear to have a lot of storage out of the box; but open the bag up, and I can fit 2 15 inch laptops, 2 iPads, plenty of room for cables, and still more room for notepads and the like. So far the construction seems to be well done; I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Alison Hiltabidle

customer_reviews.title: Rolling in Style and Comfort
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! Not too big and bulky...looks good and feels sturdy. Nicely padded to protect large/small laptops and has enough room for all other "stuff" and then some. There are also mini compartments/pockets on the inside that help with organizing said stuff. Also love that I can just pack up and roll and not worry about shoulder and back pain that comes with carrying traditional laptop bags. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Zane

customer_reviews.title: Decent rolling bag for light travel for work
customer_reviews.text: There’s a lot of divisions and compartments but not good if you have little bulky items to put inside like medium size pouches. I recommend this only for people who will put flat folders or laptop. Bag Handle is very fragile and sometimes difficult to maneuver. So you need to be careful with the handle because it feels wiggly when you roll your bag and closing the handle. Good bag but I had better ones before but of course more expensive. Price is good for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: HonestShopperReview

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: This bag is very nice and professional looking. Better than the pictures on here. It’s so many compartments to this bag. Very satisfied with my purchase.***update*** This bag is amazing. It holds up so well. Best decision I made.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi

customer_reviews.title: A value based wheelie briefcase
customer_reviews.text: I needed this to get some books, a laptop, and some files around in Manhattan. It worked admirably and can quickly be picked up and then easily redeployed as a wheelie. I have no complaints except, be careful when zipping up the lower compartment that has the bellows flap as it can get caught up in the zipper. A quick adjustment to the way I zipped up the compartment made this one snag go away quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Amanaude

customer_reviews.title: Very specious! Great price!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using their other model for years and I am very much satisfied with the quality of the back and the space. My 17.5" HP Pro Book fits in it just fine, the handle is in good shape. That thing is quite heavy to carry around the airport and the wheels saved my stress. The only issue I am suspecting is the carrying handle is thin faux leather covered which is going to damage over time and it's gonna look bad, They could leave that handle as is without that! Otherwise, I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Saad A.

customer_reviews.title: This is a perfect work bag!
customer_reviews.text: I am an insurance agent so there are many things that I need to bring with me to appointments. Files, brochures, office supplies, laptop, phone...too many to mention. Not only do I need a lot of space for these things, it gets very heavy. This bag has all the space need and more! I like my things to be organized so that I'm not searching for items in an appointment. It has plenty of pockets to keep all of my things the way I want them and space for more. The wheels roll easily over a variety of surfaces. I've had several work bags over the years, this by far is the best!
customer_reviews.author: miss murphy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, attractive bag
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, attractive bag. I can fit both my laptop and my cooling stand in the laptop compartment at the back, and also use that pocket for things like my mousepad, wireless mouse, charging cords, etc. The next pocket down is ideal for textbooks / notebooks, and the front pocket is great for keys, pens, wallet, etc. The very front pocket is where I tend to keep my phone - it is nice and padded and I don't worry about it at all. The wheels & handle are ideal since my bag is heavily full of crap.
customer_reviews.author: Tarz

customer_reviews.title: This case can take it and give you easy movement also.
customer_reviews.text: Love this vag. It is about my 8th and it runs circles around the rest. Very durable with lots of space and compartments. Long, sturdy handle that allows me to stand straight and take long strides with out fear of something catching or hanging up. Sturdy handles for lifting and they are set just right so I don’t have to hunt for them. A lot of thinking and experience went into the design of this bag. Affords great protection, also.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Build quality is good, nice looking bag
customer_reviews.text: I have mixed feelings about this computer bag. It replaced a Samsonite back I used for 8 years, the wheels and handle wore out. Build quality is good, nice looking bag. Spacious inside for folio, laptop, accessories and one night's clothing if needed (I even fit a pair of dress shoes in for one trip!). Two negative comments; one, it's tall - taller than it needs to be for any 15" or 17" laptop. Two, small items like USB drives get lost in the outside zipper pocket, which has a welt seam along the bottom and deep corners.
customer_reviews.author: Sam N Renkin

customer_reviews.title: Good looking bag and rolls well
customer_reviews.text: What I don't like is that it's not quite as large as I had hoped. I'm a law student and I have some heavy duty books (operative word - heavy). This doesn't expand as wide to accommodate more than (2) 1'' binders, 1 hornbook, a paperback and my laptop and its tight. There is also some funky, cheap vinly type siding inside that could be improved. What I do like is the style of the bag and the quality of the wheels, how I hate a poorly rolling bag. Solo, Can you all make a larger one?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 😡Ruined my surprise for my wife's big promotion!!😡
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my wife because she got a promotion and would need it. The bag that is displayed is not the bag you get. If you read the model number in the description and do just a little research you will find that the pictures are far from what that model number is. Thankfully amazon is awesome about returning items. It also showed up with a huge dent on one for the handle rails too. Not very well packaged. That one is on its way back and a new one (correct model number) is on the way
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Not loving it
customer_reviews.text: I am a court reporter. I bought this bag because I need something sturdy for daily use. It says it fits a 17-inch laptop, and it does, but it's very, very tight. It barely fits. The zippers are not very sturdy and constantly get caught on the inside mesh on the bottom sides. I have to basically use one side of the zipper and then leave an open gap of about two inches. I'm not happy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Katiebug

customer_reviews.title: Solid bag, some design flaws
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, strong, lots of separate spaces. However, you cannot use all pockets fully because there is not enough structural space in the bag. I end up stuffing too many folders, books eTc in the main compartment, which makes it hard to find what I am looking for.... maybe it’s just me; I have lots of material to carry.
customer_reviews.author: rkdoulou

customer_reviews.title: Durable and spacious product!!
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a late bday gift for my Dad. Thought of ordering this laptop bag/ suitcase for him since he’s moved in to a new house and have been working on organizing his Imp documents. He loves it and was extremely happy that it is spacious and comes with wheels for him to travel with it. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: ZAUREZ MALIK

customer_reviews.title: It is strong, has a lot of pockets, and fits in overhead airplane bins
customer_reviews.text: My partner needed a new rolling briefcase for work and this was such a wonderful find on Amazon! It rolls, has a tall adjustable handle, soooo many pockets, waterproof (which we found out works because an idiot dropped her coffee on the bag), and holds large laptops! We have even stuffed shoes, clothes, AND two laptops in here! Will buy again if this briefcase ever goes out on us.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Algos

customer_reviews.title: Our Company's Go-To Rolling Laptop Bag
customer_reviews.text: This is our second purchase of this bag. We love the size and ease of use. I don't want my staff to injure their shoulders trying to pack laptops and accessories around, so we use these bags as our mobile offices for work-remote days. Also, I live in a city and walk to work. This bag can take a beating on our urban sidewalks, curbs, and construction zones without showing the wear!
customer_reviews.author: Patois

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS BAG
customer_reviews.text: I love this little work horse bag. It fits my laptop perfect and I have a 19" diameter screen. Lots of extra room for all the office essentials needed and even my husband's smaller laptop. Fits perfect under the airplane seat for travel even on the smallest commuter planes. It's stylish and my shoulder says thank you. It's a much better option than the shoulder strap bag I have been using for travel. Best purchase in a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy T.

customer_reviews.title: Very Tight Fit!!!
customer_reviews.text: My 17" Predator will only fit into the case if I add force and the bag cannot be even halfway full. Most days I leave it unzipped and computer in sideways. Sturdy built, just not enough room for my 17" computer, cords, and files.
customer_reviews.author: ANDREA H RUTLAND

customer_reviews.title: Looks and is as described
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace my shoulder bag with something on wheels. This bag has enough space to include my laptop in the main compartment and other items as well. Also has space for folders, another zip space for mobile devices, and a space to slide in pens pencils really small devices and other miscellaneous items. As for durability, I have to respond in 6 months to a year.
customer_reviews.author: Beeblebrox

customer_reviews.title: Already has a clicky wheel; wish I'd bought another Samsonite
customer_reviews.text: I have had this bag for about a month. The wheel got a rock stuck in it, and I dragged it 30 yards across a parking lot. This is my fault so I am confident that Solo will not be willing to do anything about it. I was replacing a Samsonite rolling laptop bag I had gotten from my dad. He had already used it on hundreds of work trips over the course of 5 years, and I had it for another 5 years. I was trying to save $20 and have learned my lesson.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas J.

customer_reviews.title: Very Functional
customer_reviews.text: I use this bag for my work: for laptop, note book, business cards, brochure, etc. Works well. I walk between hospitals while rolling the bag behind. Past problems with these bags is the wheels don't withstand the wear and tear on the concrete side walks. The wheels crack. This one has been amazingly durable. The only negative is the zipper if opened too far, it is hard to pull the zipper back up to close the bag. I can live with this problem as long as the wheels can withstand my daily walks between hospitals.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love this case!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice case. A lot of room for my laptop, notepad and a lot of extras. The wheels roll easily and the case doesn't fall over when I let go of it. The only drawback I found is that I wish the handle swiveled. When I am pulling the case behind me my arm and wrist are in an awkward position. It wouldn't affect most people but I have bursitis and have to adjust sometimes when I'm pulling. Otherwise this case is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: VMK

customer_reviews.title: Great Portable Office
customer_reviews.text: Like so many of us, I'm working remotely more than in person these days, and have to carry a lot of weight to and from my home and work. This rolling office has saved me! I often have to walk down uneven sidewalks and it handles the trip beautifully. A life saver!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia C. Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Good - except for the wheels
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice roller bag. Except for the wheels. I exchanged my first order for another bag because the wheels would frequently make rubbing/scratching sounds and resist against rolling. But the replacement bag does the same thing. It's working despite this problem, but I am annoyed that this product is defected by default.
customer_reviews.author: Xstime

customer_reviews.title: I love this bag
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag! I had the Kenneth Cole version of this (faux leather) and used it constantly for 5 years before the wheels went bad and I considered ordering that one again -- but I'm glad I didn't. I like this one even better! Great size and layout of compartments and looks really sharp. This one is a little wider but it's not as thick (front to back) as the KC version when all compartments are full. The telescoping handle feels a little less sturdy than my last bag but so far so good. The 2 small carry handles are great for grabbing and carrying too. Highly recommend this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy Camper
customer_reviews.text: This case is not used weekly but averages monthly. After about a year it holds up well, rolls through airports with no trouble and fits in the overhead or under the seat ahead. The quality of workmanship is good, the zippers work fine, no problems with the handle and it has changed my dread of having a carry-on bag to delight as it rolls along behind me. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Wordspeak

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for nearly three years. I fell once...very hard...throwing the bag a good distance. I had an IPAD in the bag...there was absolutely no damage to my computer or belongings inside this. It has held up wonderfully over the years....still looks new!!!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and Price is right
customer_reviews.text: Little tight on 17.3 laptop, lots of space else where, good layout of pockets. Has room for tablet as well also track ball and space ball and other paraphernalia. Went through security like a breeze,rolling is great for when gates are at opposite terminals of airport. Fits nicely in overhead bins, even older style 737. The price is exceptionally considering a back pack that needs lugging is around twice as much, there are loop handles that can be used when having a rolling suitcase.
customer_reviews.author: ron white

customer_reviews.title: Ok bag but not
customer_reviews.text: This product lasted almost a year. Have to buy another bag due to wheels breaking. Rest of bag is decent but bottom of bag is also torn up. I use it to keep paperwork in. I go back and forth to work with it. I wouldn’t buy it again because it didn’t last long and I was only carrying paperwork and some books in it.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Morgan

customer_reviews.title: HP Envy dv7 Notebook PC fits
customer_reviews.text: My HP ENVY dv7 Notebook PC is not so slim with it's big battery. But it fits, although just barely. It's tight as a glove, but it fits. I just received this case, so I think it will work just fine. It looks good and sturdy. It will hold quite a few smaller paperback books, magazines and file folders. It also has an extra padded pocket in front for phone or tablet. The second compartment also has pockets for credit cards and other minor items. Very nice!
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! Exactly what i needed.
customer_reviews.text: Im using this for a few weeks now daily.. I have 2 computers a large note book and large calendar and it still has room. I was concerned that it would topple over because of the weight but its very sturdy. I returned a previously purchased case which was double the price of this one, because it kept toppling over. Im very happy with my purchase. Especially at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Pugliese

customer_reviews.title: ... up - it’s taken some abuse and held up great for the semester I’ve used it for so far
customer_reviews.text: Use this for all my materials for nursing school - books all way 40+ lbs and I fill this thing up - it’s taken some abuse and held up great for the semester I’ve used it for so far. I’d recommend as it’s been very durable for me and holds a lot of materials, from laptop, to textbooks, to papers etc.
customer_reviews.author: LMD

customer_reviews.title: I bought this to replace an older bag which was still intact but pretty torn up
customer_reviews.text: its ok but the bottom is starting to tear and its 4 months old...I bought this to replace an older bag which was still intact but pretty torn up.I will have to go back to my old one if this starts leaking. Like the bag and the room, but I think its ok to say that this bag wouldnt stand up on the sidewalks of NY when it has torn up leaving my house and going in and out of my hospital workplace and back...Wouldnt buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Carron Smith

customer_reviews.title: Holding up to everyday use.
customer_reviews.text: Although I liked the traveling case from the beginning, I wanted to wait to see how it would hold up after a few months of use and abuse. Happy to say it has performed well, especially at this price point. Nice roomy sections, lots of pockets and storage within the larger zippered compartments. I have used this bag every day, dragging it on sidewalks, parking lots, even gravel and it’s held up well. Little scuffing on the bottom, but not bad at all.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa M. Otteni

customer_reviews.title: Stinks to the high heavens...
customer_reviews.text: The ONLY reason this brief doesn't get five stars is for the smell. Whew! It's a plastic/formaldehyde smell and I sure hope it goes away in time because I woke up the other morning with a headache from the odor. I have to put the bag outside when I bring work home. I bought this to replace an eBag that was just too big for my liking. I love everything about this bag, except it's BO.
customer_reviews.author: B.T.Bullet

customer_reviews.title: OK but would prefer expanding with shoulder strap
customer_reviews.text: This is ok but I was hoping it compacted/expanded better and had a shoulder strap. I was looking for something versatile enough to carry on shoulder when just a couple of notebooks are in there, and roll it when it's full but this would only work for rolling when it's full. The largest compartment does not collapse at all, so a little unwieldy for carrying on shoulder
customer_reviews.author: TP

customer_reviews.title: Not durable, wheels are getting stuck
customer_reviews.text: Would have been my favorite if not durability issue! Pros: large capacity, lots of compartments, easy to open and close. Nice telescopic handle, smooth function. Cons: not durable. After 2 months one of the wheels is half gone. I use it outside on workdays. The distance between parking and my workplace is about 200 feet and apparently it killed the bag. The wheel was getting stuck every time, so the bag end up being dragged, not rolled. Besides, the fabric on the lower edges is getting ripped, the logo broke in half.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia Lauk. Pianist.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect in every way
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased it, I thought it said it was lightly used, but I find it hard to believe it was used at all. It came wrapped in original packaging with attached tags. The bag itself is light weight but sturdy, rolls easily, and holds my super large computer and all of it's peripheral devices with room to spare. Designated space for files is quite ample as well. Most pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Leith Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Nice look, great quality
customer_reviews.text: Love this, great quality, perfect size for work when traveling to see customers, fits my literature and laptop and samples very well and rolls really nicely also. I really like the way it looks and the quality is fantastic, the handle goes up easily to pull and goes back down easily for storage. I thought it was well priced also compared to what I found at Staples.
customer_reviews.author: Big shopper

customer_reviews.title: Durability
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bag in October 2018 and is still holding, beginning to look a little tattered on the bottom but using it everyday except when I am off from work it is still holding up. I am auditor so it gets a lot of wear and tear going from agency to agency not to mention the amount of stuff carried in it. It has adequate space and compartments for everything. I plan to order another, I just wish this exact same bag was a spinner instead of a rolling bag. Excellent quality for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Antoinette

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: The zippers are a little sticky and could move easier. Overall it's made my life commuting back and forth to work easier during this covid-19 pandemic as I have to go back and forth to the office once or twice a week now. I had an over-the-shoulder computer bag but it was just too heavy with all my notebooks my headset my computer and my wrist guard.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Stanton,Mary Stanton

customer_reviews.title: The perfect bag for me
customer_reviews.text: The perfect bag for me, the large compartment can fit the laptop power supply, a sweatshirt and headphone case for when I travel, and misc. stuff for daily use. I bought this to replace an identical one I had for a few years, but one of the strap handles was hanging on by a few threads, and the wheels were noisy due to all the dirt and stuff I roll it through.. Fits in all but the tiny overhead compartments. I use it a lot, so it takes a beating, I don't mind replacing it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: This bag is holding up well. I have used it extensively to transport a laptop and various books and papers. The wheels roll well and there is a lot of room in the various pockets. The handle is easy to both extend and to put away and the zippers are all working well. It shows no signs of wear after a full year of school use.
customer_reviews.author: NANCY WESTON

customer_reviews.title: Handle sticks when new
customer_reviews.text: In a previous review I read this and yes it did stick when new the 2nd time I tried to push it back it stuck for a few minutes then freed up and has never been an issue since. Good Quality and seems to stand up to repeated drops etc.
customer_reviews.author: Moose

customer_reviews.title: ... well over a year now and it's holding up great. I am seriously impressed with the zippers on ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been abusing this bag for well over a year now and it's holding up great. I am seriously impressed with the zippers on this bag! I stuff this bag so full that I'm always sure the zippers are going to bust and they never do! The bag still looks great and is functioning perfectly. It has lots of compartments to store everything. I love this bag and would totally purchase it again. You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Queenie7777

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and rolls smoothly
customer_reviews.text: Love this rolling laptop case. It is very sturdy and we'll made. I have a 17 inch laptop that I carry everyday. It fits snuggly into the padded laptop pocket in the main section of the bag. The other zippered pockets are convenient for storing files and other things I need for my real estate business on the go. The bag rolls very smoothly. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tori

customer_reviews.title: Don't "stuff" it
customer_reviews.text: The first time I traveled with this, one of the zippers "popped" and had to be unjammed, run back down to get the zipper reconnected to itself, and run back up. A couple of the zipper teeth were bent, so it was a tough job to get it working again, and I don't have a lot of confidence that it will hold up for the long-term. It was packed pretty tight, but I would have expected better durability than this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wheels are a major design flaw, does not hold up to regular use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son to use at school, it appeared attractive and had good organization. The wheels however are made of some horribly cheap flimsy and weak material, it only lasted a few months at most, the wheels look melted and crushed in the back, and it's useless. I'm extremley disappointed, we had to trash it.
customer_reviews.author: Zia

customer_reviews.title: This is a Great case for the price
customer_reviews.text: Looked at a bunch of cases. More expensive and least expensive. After checking the reviews out of all of them I settled with this one. Main reason, The wheels. Other cases wheels seem to wear out a lot faster. This is a Great case for the price. I believe it will outlast other cases that are $20-$50 more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this bag! I am a 'floater' for my company which means in a given week I can be at 5 different locations. This is my traveling desk, since I really do not have a desk of my own anywhere. It looks great, wearing well as I pull it across multiple parking lots all over the place. Fits all my personal stuff, lots of room for large notebooks. If this thing ever does wear out, I'll get another.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.  Lots of pockets and WHISPER QUIET!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had it for a week. Awesome. Zippers were perfect. Came perfectly wrapped in plastic. No holes or wearing. QUIET! So QUIET! I thought choosing the cheaper one would be a mistake but these wheels on a hardwood floor are smooth and super quiet! Buy this!!
customer_reviews.author: Denarella

customer_reviews.title: Lots of space, but not too heavy
customer_reviews.text: This is a very spacious bag. I actually did not buy this for a laptop, but to carry a lot of notebooks and other items for an organization of which I am a member. I would have been happy with half of its storage, which would have just carried the papers I needed. But with all the spaces it has allowed me to store everything in one bag. I just roll it to the car, and I am off with everything I need.
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: doesnt fit 17 inch HPZBOOK 17G2 and bottom/back compartment is not padded
customer_reviews.text: It appears to be a very nice rolling laptop case BUT unfortunately my laptop does not fit in the padded compartment. I have an HP ZBOOK 17G2 and although the description says fits most 17.3 inch laptops mine does not fit in the padded section intended for the laptop. I am very disappointed-based on the description, it should fit. The laptop dimensions are 17.25 inch screen, 16 3/8 inch Long and 10 5/8 inches Wide. It does fit in the compartment in the bottom/back near where the handle follows down the back; unfortunately though that section is not padded and so I am not comfortable placing the laptop in that area.
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: Performed great in the rain
customer_reviews.text: I took this to a conference in a rainy city. I had to walk a couple blocks from my hotel to the conference center. I was worried the case would end up damaged from the rain/wet ground, but I needn't have worried. The case was perfect. It fit under the airline seat, but was a bit hard to maneuver it down there. That is due more to the tiny space in planes than any problem with the case itself.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Like it but....
customer_reviews.text: I like this rolling cart. It has plenty of space and compartments. The price is very fair. However, the first one I ordered did develop a rip on a seam. That was disappointing, but things happen. I was more than impressed by how trouble free it was for me to get another one no questions asked through Amazon. So, overall I rate this product a 4 but had I not had the rip happen I would have rated it a 5.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Butt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, but still a carry-on
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. However, it’s too big to go under the airplane seat, so you’ll have to pay carry-on fee. I’m going to have to get a smaller one for traveling. I love this case, though, and really wish the airlines would change their sizing so I could call this a personal item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: bearings going out already in the wheels
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this in December its now July and the bearing on one of the wheels are going out I use my laptop bag a lot and need something to hold up and this is not...... if not for the bearing issue the bag is good. Disappointed in this as the rest of the bag is holding up well So now what ....
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Better suited for a 17" laptop
customer_reviews.text: While my Gigabyte P27 v2 fits in the laptop slot it is very tight and I have to open the compartment fully to get it in and out, kind of pain when going through TSA at the airport and getting it to slide down perfectly strait can be annoying. Build quality is great though and it has withstood several bumps and tosses (without laptop in it) like a champ. I am pretty hard on my luggage and this thing is holding up better than I thought.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: DAILY Commuter - Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I use the bag every day for about 4 months. It's been a life saver in this new world where I work 1/2 day in the field and 1/2 day at home. Sturdy, fits a LOT - looks nice. I am in the maintenance/operations business (mgt) - this holds all my docs, pc, cables, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannette Ford

customer_reviews.title: Not this one!
customer_reviews.text: Product was purchased to carry around office essentials. : Laptop, cables, paperwork etc. Toppled over with only a few things in it. Storage capacity iffy, seems good but was unstable with a couple of books. Used it for one day and the inferior zip, ran off. Can't comment on durability fairly as these things occurred early in my care. Its packaging was dismantled for recycling before I could use it properly, so haven't returned it. Size for travelling and fitting in an overhead bin is good. Wheels and handle are wobbly. Would NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Baje

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this bag!
customer_reviews.text: I had a non-wheeled version of this bag and really loved the quality. After researching, I decided to buy the same brand in this wheeled version. I absolutely love it. No more sore back and shoulders. My purse also fits on the top nicely. It goes up stairs easily. Stands perfectly on its own, which is actually quite handy when you put it in the floor board of your vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: MommaZ

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit all 17.3" laptops
customer_reviews.text: My laptop has a 17.3" screen and it's dimensions are 16.46" x 11.52" x 0.98". My laptop did not even come close to fitting in the padded section and when I tried putting it in the biggest section of the bag the zipper would not close. I'm not sure this bag would fit any laptop over 15". The bag seemed like it was pretty good quality, I gave it 1 star because the description was inaccurate.
customer_reviews.author: Summer Piper

customer_reviews.title: Love this rolling case!
customer_reviews.text: I had a laptop case from work and bought a wheeled cart for it because it is a portable work station and heavy. It was not very stable and eventually the clip broke. This is such a better solution!!! It rolls well with no wobble and I can access all three pockets with it standing up! I highly recommend this rolling bag!!! It is high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Softwaregirl

customer_reviews.title: Rugged, Spacious, and Convenient ... but the handle
customer_reviews.text: I have been thrilled with this briefcase. I needed a rolling briefcase because I have to lug around two not-so-light laptops (one 17" and one 15.5") along with power cords, and other mobile office things. It holds everything in separate compartments with easy access. My only concern is that the handle seems like it could break right off so I go out of my way to baby it. It could be the manufacturer was trying to avoid adding extra weight but it seems like a more durable handle would have been a great complement to the sturdiness of the briefcase itself. But the briefcase has been absolutely terrific so far.
customer_reviews.author: rmg

customer_reviews.title: Big enough but doesn't take up too much room
customer_reviews.text: As an outdoor landscape and pool designer I needed a bag to carry my laptop and other tools. This works great and so far has been durable. my 17" laptop fits snugly and is easy to get to when I need it. This was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Redsun

customer_reviews.title: Just what you need
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by this Laptop bag. It is ver sturdy, and the capacity is good. The part that I like best is that the bag doesn’t topple over when I am loading it. If you are looking for a basic labtop rolling bag, you can’t go wrong with this.
customer_reviews.author: Totally4me

customer_reviews.title: The material is good but the zippers are cheap
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bag and its OK. The zipper failed in about 4 months and one of the wheels locked in about one year. The material is good but the zippers are cheap. I won't be purchasing another one of this brand. My last laptop bag lasted about 4 years. I use it everyday so if I got 2 years out of it I would be happy but the quality on this bag is kind of cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Williams

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT fit an Alienware 17 R5 laptop
customer_reviews.text: Does NOT fit an Alienware 17m laptop. So frustrating to have to return and also lose $10 to ship it back. I should have known better. Might be a good case for anything smaller. Too frustrated to tell as I needed this now for a trip. Had to box it back up and find time to ship it back. Grrrr
customer_reviews.author: Lightworkertoo

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag ... perfect size!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I wanted something with wheels that I can use to combine my laptop/briefcase and make-up/toiletry bags. Working great so far! Case is lightweight, well-made, zippers operate smoothly, and, so far, the wheels are working well. Metal zipper pulls also have holes large enough to accomodate luggage locks.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't I buy this earlier?
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I suffer from my back and this is a relief from my backpack. And you can't possibly imagine how much stuff you can carry! Love it. Would definitely buy it again and will recommend it 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Muriel Diaz Urrutia

product_meta.title: Solo Bryant Rolling Laptop Bag with Wheels,Fits Up to 17.3-Inch Laptop,Travel Friendly Wheeled Briefcase for Women and Men with Telescoping Handle-Black
product_meta.description: Size:14" x 16.8" x 5"| Color:BlackIf you’re in search of a durable, travel-friendly laptop bag, Solo New York Bryant is a high-quality solution. The New York Bryant Rolling Laptop Bag features a padded laptop compartment with a secure strap that can protect up to a 17.3-inch laptop. The easy-glide wheels and loads of storage space make it perfect for travel. It’s a diverse computer bag that can be used as a roller or carry-along. This rolling bag is perfect for men or women, weighs only one pound, and is comfortable to carry around town or anywhere you travel. For additional organization, Solo have included a second zippered accordion file compartment that helps organize bulky files. The New York Bryant is likewise a travel-friendly travel rolling bag that fits in most airline overhead compartments. The push button telescoping handle retracts into a zippered compartment when not in use, allowing you to roll or carry it with ease. All Solo New York travel bags are designed to provide flexibility for those who are constantly on the go. In fact, since 2008, Rolling bags with a unique style inspired by the bustling streets of New York City. The New York Bryant is backed by a five-year warranty.
feature_bullets: Laptop bag for commute and business: The Solo New York Bryant Rolling Laptop Bag features a padded laptop compartment with a secure strap that can protect up to a 17.3-inch laptop; The easy-glide wheels and loads of storage space make it perfect for travel

Organized mobile office: This rolling bag includes a spacious compartment that accommodates notebooks, binders, and must-have documents; The second zippered accordion file compartment helps organize bulky files

Quick access: Our rolling laptop bag is packed with loads of storage; The full-size front zipper organizer compartment includes multiple pockets, while the front pocket offers quick access for travel essentials

Travel friendly: This is a travel-friendly rolling bag that fits in most airline overhead compartments; The push button telescoping handle retracts into a zippered compartment when not in use, allowing you to roll or carry it with ease
5-Year warranty: Guaranteed to be unstoppable; Every bag is guaranteed to be free from defects in materials and craftsmanship for five years from the date of purchase

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,044 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
